data.title: Fix ContentManager to compile in Mac partial class. Add back support to
data.body: load Effects in global ContentManager partial class.

data.title: ContentManager improvements
data.body:
Common ContentManager with partial specializations for opening streams. 
Proper handling of IDisposable assets.
Re-using previously loaded assets when requested again.

Tested on Android.  Contains required changes for other platforms.  Needs testing on those platforms.

data.title: UIApplication.SharedApplication.StatusBarHidden being called via IsFullScreen in loops
data.body: It seems that some people have calls to IsFullScreen within their update loop. This was causing a slow down as it was making a call to UIApplication.SharedApplication.StatusBarHidden. This value is now cached.

data.title: Fix for GetData Mac and iOS and Draw Regression
data.body:
See discussion here for the modification suggestions by Tapini.

http://monogame.codeplex.com/workitem/6625

Fix regression for Draw where setting the SamplerState was causing drawing problems.

data.title: Change to fix Pan Gesture and Mouse Sync, as suggested by John Holmes
Added support for ApplyChanges
data.body: This also sets the BackBuffer - Width and Height correctly.

data.title: Changes to ensure Gestures pick up correct translatedTouchPosition.
data.body:
Changes to ensure Gestures pick up correct translatedTouchPosition. Thanks akenaton for spotting this.
There may still be more tweaks required to other gestures in future. Hold, Tap and Double Tap should be accurate for starters.

data.title: Develop
data.body: Mouse classes copied from Linux to Windows, in order to support mouse click detection on Windows

data.title: Develop
data.body:
SpriteFont.MeasureString didn't work correctly.
Changes to MeadiaPlayer.IsRepeating weren't applied to the current song.

data.title: Changes to Sound.cs and Project files to allow Windows project to compile easily.
data.body: You may still need to point the OpenTK file to the correct place. This will be addressed  later this week.

data.title: Changes in Sound.cs files in iOS and MacOS needed to change to allow compilation.
Added code to Pause and Resume sounds on Backgrounding/Foregrounding
Android Pause sound on Background
data.body: This adds code to the Game class to pause all playing sounds on Background and resume them on Foreground.

data.title: Change Sound.cs to use SoundPool on Android
data.body:
Change Sound.cs to use SoundPool on Android

Updated the Android project to include the VertexElementColor.cs

data.title: Matrix, Quaternion, Vector2 and Vector3 modifications
data.body:
Added some internal helper methods to Quaternion and added Transform methods for quaternion to Vector3.

Add ToString implementation to Matrix class

Also added implementation to Vector2 methods that were not implemented

data.title: Refactored the iOS Mouse class to keep touches and mouse movement in sync.
data.body: Refactored the iOS Mouse class to be a little neater. Now touches and Mouse should be in better sync. Also updated the Android project to include VertextElementColor.cs.

data.title: Fix Color Array ClientState Setting as pointed out by Scott Dancer
data.body: I was double setting the Client State for Color Array.  It is being set in BasicEffect and should not be set in the PrepareForUse method as my change does it.  Thanks Scott

data.title: Cherry Picked Dean's changes and resending the pull request.
Fixes for Android Viewport and Orientation bug
data.body:
This request contains a fix for the Android ViewPort issue
and a fix for the orientation issue on https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/119

for some reason it also contains a bunch of files I did nto change when I merged the development branch... I'm not sure if I did something wrong.

data.title: iOS - Song .stop() does not function as expected
data.body: The music track only seems to pause instead of stopping.

data.title: Android - Rotating device with only portatit mode crash
data.body: If you only have Portrait as the Supported Mode in device rotations, the screen goes black and the application becomes unresponsive.

data.title: Android - Rendering/Viewport issues
data.body: Rendering textures to a Rectangle causes unexpected behavior. Textures are stretched/positioned incorrectly.

data.title: Android - Sounds play in background
data.body: Sound/Music does not stop when minimizing applications.

data.title: Fix Color Array so that colors show up correctly for vertices and  DrawIndexedPrimitives
data.body:
Added a new class to represent Colors in Vertices called VertexElementColor
Make sure ClientState turns on ColorArray if we are using colors
Clean up the UnsetGraphicsStates so that we are not calling state changes when not needed

Added support for DrawIndexPrimitives non generic version.
IndexBuffer made XNA 4.0 compliant
IndexElementSize added for XNA 4.0 and implemented in IndexBuffer

VR and other samples now show up with correct color schemes

data.title: Added support for SetVertexBuffer and CullMode fixes
data.body:
Added support for GraphicsDevice.SetVertexBuffer and GraphicsDevice.DrawPrimitives.  

See StateObjectWindows Sample.

Fix CullMode to default to CounterClockwise as per documentation
Modified state setting opengl parameters to make vertexes run properly again after RasterizerState modifications

data.title: Added Location property to Rectangle as suggested by Urkle.
Texture mapping and minor changes for primitives
data.body:
Get Quad Texture mapping working.  

Modified the GetElementCountArray routine to fix TriangleList as it was being calculated incorrectly for the samples.  

Also Modified LineStrip as it was showing extraneous lines.  

TriangleStrip was also modified for the Samples as some lines were showing up and on other tests it was missing lines.

data.title: Various fixes for Landscape, backbuffer width and height and missing ContentReaders
data.body:
Added properties to make it more XNA 4 compatible.

Code to fix the Landscape viewport cutoff error.

BackBuffer Width and Height should now be set correctly under iOS

Added several Content Readers to the project that existed but seemed to have been overlooked.

data.title: Support for multiple PS and VS shaders in BasicEffect
data.body:
Add multiple PS and VS shader programs to BasicEffect with the ability to change between them depending on the parameters that are set.

Things still are not working correctly but this would be the base for now until we get it cleaned up.

data.title: Shader Usage and a little cleanup
data.body:
Start using shader in BasicEffect
Make sure we unset our graphics states after drawing primitives.
Moved Stencil code to GLStateManager for cleanup and deleted unused module.
